agent_prompt.role: You are an expert software architect responsible for implementing Phase 2 for the sophia-intel-ai codebase.

context.current_state: Phase 1 complete - archives consolidated, requirements cleaned, scripts organized
context.codebase_scale: Large Python monorepo with multi-agent services
context.security: API keys located at ${HOME}/.config/sophia/env (Make target: sophia-setup)

agent_prompt.instructions: Review this plan, improve where needed, and implement changes incrementally with tests and documentation. Maintain backward compatibility throughout.

phase2_objectives.title: Docker Compose Consolidation
phase2_objectives.description: Consolidate compose usage with a canonical base file and profiles; align docs with Makefile and helper scripts.

phase2_objectives.title: Large File Refactoring (Prioritized)
phase2_objectives.description: Refactor a prioritized subset of >50KB modules (5 high-churn/core files) with proxy shims to preserve imports.

phase2_objectives.title: HTTP Client Standardization
phase2_objectives.description: Standardize on app/core/async_http_client.py (httpx) as the canonical client; add minimal adapters as needed.

phase2_objectives.title: Package Structure Enhancement
phase2_objectives.description: Improve packages/sophia_core exports and documentation; ship typing markers.

tasks.description: Inventory compose files and services; produce services parity matrix.
Keep docker-compose.yml as canonical base for compatibility; use profiles for optional stacks.
tasks.rationale: Many tools default to docker-compose.yml; Makefile and scripts expect it.

tasks.description: Create docker-compose.override.yml for local overrides only.
Align Makefile targets and scripts with the canonical file and profiles; prefer scripts/multi-agent-docker-env.sh.
Archive redundant compose files after parity is achieved (keep dev.yml if profiles cannot fully replace it).
Update README with compose usage via Makefile and script helper; document profiles and overrides.
sections: Legacy notes on dev.yml if retained

discovery.description: Programmatically list >50KB Python files to select a prioritized subset (5).

strategy.step1: Analyze dependencies and define module boundaries
strategy.step2: git mv to new package paths to preserve history
strategy.step3: Create proxy shim at original path re-exporting symbols (emit DeprecationWarning)
strategy.step5: Run import probes and targeted tests

large_file_refactoring.proxy_shim_template:
from warnings import warn
warn("Module moved to {new_module}; this path is deprecated", DeprecationWarning, stacklevel=2)
from {new_module} import *

analysis.description: Scan for requests/aiohttp/httpx usage and categorize quick wins.

implementation.description: Use app/core/async_http_client.py as the single HTTP client entry point (httpx). Add optional sync wrapper and logging hooks.
implementation.notes: Do not create a new http_client.py with duplicated logic.

implementation.description: Update imports on touch; convert simple requests.get/post to AsyncHTTPClient methods; retain aiohttp for websocket/streaming paths for now.
implementation.quick_wins: Replace direct requests usage in orchestration and integrations where trivial

implementation.description: Run targeted tests for impacted modules, then full suite.

current_issues: Explicit exports for key base classes not guaranteed

improvements.description: Ensure packages/sophia_core/__init__.py exports BaseAgent, BaseMemory, BaseSwarm, Settings and defines __all__.
Add py.typed to include typing information in distributions.
Add README.md and ARCHITECTURE.md describing subpackages and usage.

implementation_sequence.validation: make dev-up; services parity documented; tests green
Import probes succeed; targeted tests pass

tasks: HTTP client enhancements; package exports & typing

backup_strategy.rollback_plan: Git reset to previous commit if issues

after_each_task: Run targeted pytest for changed modules
after_each_day: Manual smoke test (make status, make mcp-status)

compatibility_maintenance.import_proxies: Keep original file paths as import proxies with DeprecationWarning
compatibility_maintenance.deprecation_warnings: Warn on old import paths only after verifying proxies

quantitative.docker_files_reduced: Active compose usage consolidated to base + override (profiles for options)
quantitative.large_files_refactored: Top 5 large modules split to <30KB each
quantitative.http_calls_standardized: New changes use AsyncHTTPClient; requests usage reduced

qualitative.risk_level: Zero breaking changes to external APIs

during_implementation: ✓ Import probes succeed after each split
post_implementation: ✓ No import errors in refactored areas

critical_areas: Compose service parity must be preserved
Import paths must remain backward compatible
improvement_opportunities: Expand refactor scope if ahead of schedule
Propose additional cleanups that are low risk
